definition: one after the other/a succession of/a series of
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)

to string together/to skewer/to connect wrongly/to gang up/to rove/string/bunch/skewer/classifier for things that are strung together, or in a bunch, or in a row: string of, bunch of, series of/to make a swift or abrupt linear movement (like a bead on an abacus)/to move across

sentences.english: Looking at the artistic creations of Pan Li-hong gave rise to a series of thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 看了潘麗紅的美術創作，引發一連串的思考。

sentences.english: This cluster of record-breaking events could be merely an streak of bad luck.
sentences.chinese: 這一連串破紀錄的事件也許只是一連串的黴運。

sentences.english: This cluster of record-breaking events could be merely an streak of bad luck.
sentences.chinese: 這一連串破紀錄的事件也許只是一連串的黴運。

sentences.english: Black-tie dinners and champagne parties were being held in the capitals of Europe.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲各國首都則舉行了一連串正式慶祝晚宴。

sentences.english: Ben had it out with his roommate about coming back home so late and making a lot of noise.
sentences.chinese: 是有深夜遲歸引起一連串噪音，班因而與他起了口角。

sentences.english: The co-workers submitted a laundry list of complaints to the committee.
sentences.chinese: 員工向委員會提出一連串的抱怨。

sentences.english: English isn't just a list of English words.
sentences.chinese: 學習英語並非僅是死記一連串的單字。

sentences.english: Nobody foresaw the seismic events of the next eight years.
sentences.chinese: 沒人會想到接下8年的連串震撼性事件。

sentences.english: Children ask a seemingly never-ending stream of questions from an early age.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們從很小時就開始問一連串似乎永無止境的問題。

sentences.english: Bad days generally occur when a number of little frustrations happen in succession.
sentences.chinese: 糟糕的日子通常出現於當一連串小挫折連續發生時。

sentences.english: A series of explosions had rocked the Taj Mahal only despite midnight.
sentences.chinese: 子夜後，泰姬瑪哈大酒店響起了一連串的爆炸聲。

sentences.english: The list ended up with sweetbreads.
sentences.chinese: 那一連串菜單的最後一道是牛雜碎。

sentences.english: Various adversity has soured her view of life.
sentences.chinese: 一連串的不幸使她的人生觀變得酸腐。

sentences.english: In fact, Turtles could have had a string of losers in a row with multiple false breakouts .
sentences.chinese: 實際上，海龜們會因爲假突破而形成一連串的虧損。

sentences.english: Even in the sweltering heat, the milestones keep coming.
sentences.chinese: 儘管悶熱難當，我們已經跑過了一連串的里程碑。

sentences.english: The three candidates met in a series of debates.
sentences.chinese: 那三位候選人在一連串的辯論中碰面。
